keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport via a social media livestream.
Cagle had an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition found in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the airport terminal.
His family alerted law enforcement after receiving a tip that he was streaming on social media about attacking the airport.
Cagle was apprehended before any harm occurred, showing the effectiveness of community vigilance and timely information-sharing.
He has been charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
A close friend, Nick Roberts, indicated Cagle had schizophrenia and was on medication, and expressed concern about his mental health.
The incident was described as averted due to the proactive action of Cagle’s family and the swift response of police and federal authorities.
Atlanta Police and Homeland Security officials confirmed the firearm was illegally possessed, and are investigating how he acquired it.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted police that he had streamed on social media about shooting up the airport. Officers found an AR-15 rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, 49, had expressed intent to cause mass harm and was later charged with terroristic threats, aggravated assault, and illegal firearm possession. The incident was averted due to early warning from family and swift police action. A close friend noted Cagle struggled with schizophrenia and mental health issues. Authorities are investigating how he legally obtained the firearm. The event underscores the importance of community vigilance, social media monitoring, and mental health awareness in preventing violent acts.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Social Media Threat to Shoot Up Terminal
